    Methods in ACT with parameters of type Actor
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void Act.act​(Actor actor, long now)
    abstract method for act functionality that represents how each object should act in game time
    void ActMoveOnly.act​(Actor actor, long now)  
    void ActNothing.act​(Actor actor, long now)  
    void ActPlayer.act​(Actor actor, long now)
    This method calls restrict movement method that keeps the player within the screen, and it also checks for any death triggers and loads the correct images for the death animations
    void ActTurtle.act​(Actor actor, long now)
    aside from movement, this method is also in charge of movement animations
    void Act.restrictmovement​(Actor actor)
    This method restricts the actor from going off screen

  • Uses of Actor in obstacles

    Subclasses of Actor in obstacles
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  BackgroundImage
    This class is used for the background image and has no runtime functionality
    class  Digit
    this class is for the digits used for score and has no runtime functionality
    class  End
    This class is used for the end holes and has no runtime functinality
    class  Labels
    This class is used for the highscore and score label at the top of the screen and has no runtime functionality
    class  Log
    This class is used for the logs and its only functionality is movement
    class  Obstacle  
    class  Turtle
    this class is used for turtle and it has the turtle functionality
    class  WetTurtle
    this class is used for wet turtle and it has the turtle functionality

    Methods in Worlds with parameters of type Actor
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void World.add​(Actor actor)
    This function is used to add objects to the stage at the lowest layer, after adding the object, it calls the checknextfree to see where the object should be placed if its of the type that requires it
    void World.addfront​(Actor actor)
    function to add an actor as a child to the front of the pane, the outer most layer
    void World.remove​(Actor actor)
    Function to remove actor from the root node
